p: In our extract, total phenolic compounds amounted to 27 mg per g of extracts (0.81 mg per g of dry material). Considering the acetone as the solvent used for the extraction, our is a remarkable quantity if compared to total phenolic compounds found by Khaled et al. in Lebanese Padina pavonica (10.76 mg per g of the methanolic extract) [ 10] and by CAF et al. in Turkish Mediterranean Padina pavonica (0.96 mg per g of the aqueous extract and 1.76 mg per g of the methanolic extract) [ 11]. Pinteus et al. in Padina pavonica from Portugal, found values of 44.61 and 10.48 mg per g of extract when using methanol and dichloromethane respectively as extraction solvents [ 12]. In their work Hlila et al. determined the total phenolic content of aqueous and acetonic extract of Tunisian Padina pavonica, with values corresponding to 57.34 and 90.61 mg per g of extract, respectively [ 13].
